document:
<sentence id="s1" text="Rationale: Oncogenic regulation of transcription, DNA-templated signaling activation and 3p22-21.3 locus alteration are common in multiple tumors, especially carcinomas of the nasopharynx, esophagus and lung.">
<sentence id="s2" text="negative regulation of cell proliferation was frequently downregulated in ESCC, lung and NPC cell lines and primary tumors, but was readily expressed in normal tissues and immortalized normal epithelial cells, with mutations rarely detected.">
<sentence id="s3" text="negative regulation of cell proliferation methylation was frequently detected in ESCC tumors and correlated with lymph node metastasis, tumor recurrence and progression, with li>negative regulation of cell proliferation as the most frequently methylated among the established 3p22.2 tumor suppressors (li>RASSF1A, PLCD1 and li>ZMYND10/BLU).">
